column4: Did you write to the GRUB configuration file from scratch? You might want to copy and paste from Kubuntu's /boot/grub dir.

I didn't write manually, just added the entry using mandriva boot manager tool, specified the partition and then the vmlinuz and initrd... don't know if the fact that mandriva uses grub, instead of grub2 is a problem
I was just wondering if you based it off of the default bootloader configuration.
I don't think grub/grub2 should make a difference. I'm not an expert, though.
